member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaHookMask
member.summary: Lua Hook Event Masks

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookMask.Disabled
member.summary: Disabled hook

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookMask.Call
member.summary: The call hook: is called when the interpreter calls a function. The hook is called just after Lua enters the new function, before the function gets its arguments.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookMask.Return
member.summary: The return hook: is called when the interpreter returns from a function. The hook is called just before Lua leaves the function. There is no standard way to access the values to be returned by the function.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookMask.Line
member.summary: The line hook: is called when the interpreter is about to start the execution of a new line of code, or when it jumps back in the code (even to the same line). (This event only happens while Lua is executing a Lua function.)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookMask.Count
member.summary: The count hook: is called after the interpreter executes every count instructions. (This event only happens while Lua is executing a Lua function.)

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaFunction
member.summary: Type for C# callbacks In order to communicate properly with Lua, a C function must use the following protocol, which defines the way parameters and results are passed: a C function receives its arguments from Lua in its stack in direct order (the first argument is pushed first). So, when the function starts, lua_gettop(L) returns the number of arguments received by the function. The first argument (if any) is at index 1 and its last argument is at index lua_gettop(L). To return values to Lua, a C function just pushes them onto the stack, in direct order (the first result is pushed first), and returns the number of results. Any other value in the stack below the results will be properly discarded by Lua. Like a Lua function, a C function called by Lua can also return many results.

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaHookFunction
member.summary: Type for debugging hook functions callbacks.

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaKFunction
member.summary: Type for continuation functions

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaReader
member.summary: The reader function used by lua_load. Every time it needs another piece of the chunk, lua_load calls the reader, passing along its data parameter. The reader must return a pointer to a block of memory with a new piece of the chunk and set size to the block size

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaAlloc
member.summary: The type of the memory-allocation function used by Lua states. The allocator function must provide a functionality similar to realloc

member.name: T:KeraLua.Lua
member.summary: Lua state class, main interface to use Lua library.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.Handle
member.summary: Internal Lua handle pointer.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.Encoding
member.summary: Encoding for the string conversions ASCII by default.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.ExtraSpace
member.summary: Returns a pointer to a raw memory area associated with the given Lua state. The application can use this area for any purpose; Lua does not use it for anything. Each new thread has this area initialized with a copy of the area of the main thread.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.MainThread
member.summary: Get the main thread object, if the object is the main thread will be equal this

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize Lua state, and open the default libs
member.param: flag to enable/disable opening the default libs

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.#ctor(KeraLua.LuaAlloc,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initialize Lua state with allocator function and user data value This method will NOT open the default libs. Creates a new thread running in a new, independent state. Returns NULL if it cannot create the thread or the state (due to lack of memory). The argument f is the allocator function; Lua does all memory allocation for this state through this function (see lua_Alloc). The second argument, ud, is an opaque pointer that Lua passes to the allocator in every call.
member.param: LuaAlloc allocator function called to alloc/free memory

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.FromIntPtr(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the Lua object from IntPtr Useful for LuaFunction callbacks, if the Lua object was already collected will return null.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer, will dispose the lua state if wasn't closed

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose lua state

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Close
member.summary: Destroys all objects in the given Lua state (calling the corresponding garbage-collection metamethods, if any) and frees all dynamic memory used by this state

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the lua context (calling Close)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.AbsIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the acceptable index idx into an equivalent absolute index (that is, one that does not depend on the stack top).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Arith(KeraLua.LuaOperation)
member.summary: Performs an arithmetic or bitwise operation over the two values (or one, in the case of negations) at the top of the stack, with the value at the top being the second operand, pops these values, and pushes the result of the operation. The function follows the semantics of the corresponding Lua operator (that is, it may call metamethods).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.AtPanic(KeraLua.LuaFunction)
member.summary: Sets a new panic function and returns the old one

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Call(System.Int32,System.Int32)
M:KeraLua.Lua.CallK(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaKFunction)
member.summary: This function behaves exactly like lua_call, but allows the called function to yield

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckStack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Ensures that the stack has space for at least n extra slots (that is, that you can safely push up to n values into it). It returns false if it cannot fulfill the request,

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Compare(System.Int32,System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaCompare)
member.summary: Compares two Lua values. Returns 1 if the value at index index1 satisfies op when compared with the value at index index2

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Concat(System.Int32)
member.summary: Concatenates the n values at the top of the stack, pops them, and leaves the result at the top. If n is 1, the result is the single value on the stack (that is, the function does nothing);

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Copy(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the element at index fromidx into the valid index toidx, replacing the value at that position

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CreateTable(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new empty table and pushes it onto the stack. Parameter narr is a hint for how many elements the table will have as a sequence; parameter nrec is a hint for how many other elements the table will have

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Dump(KeraLua.LuaWriter,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dumps a function as a binary chunk. Receives a Lua function on the top of the stack and produces a binary chunk that, if loaded again, results in a function equivalent to the one dumped

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Error
member.summary: Generates a Lua error, using the value at the top of the stack as the error object. This function does a long jump

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GarbageCollector(KeraLua.LuaGC,System.Int32)
member.summary: Controls the garbage collector.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetAllocFunction(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Returns the memory-allocation function of a given state. If ud is not NULL, Lua stores in *ud the opaque pointer given when the memory-allocator function was set.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetField(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[k], where t is the value at the given index. As in Lua, this function may trigger a metamethod for the "index" event (see §2.4). Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetField(KeraLua.LuaRegistry,System.String)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[k], where t is the value at the given index. As in Lua, this function may trigger a metamethod for the "index" event (see §2.4). Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetGlobal(System.String)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value of the global name. Returns the type of that value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetInteger(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[i], where t is the value at the given index
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetInfo(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific function or function invocation.
member.returns: This function returns false on error (for instance, an invalid option in what).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetInfo(System.String,KeraLua.LuaDebug@)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific function or function invocation.
member.returns: This function returns false on error (for instance, an invalid option in what).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetLocal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about a local variable of a given activation record or a given function.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetLocal(KeraLua.LuaDebug,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about a local variable of a given activation record or a given function.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetMetaTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: If the value at the given index has a metatable, the function pushes that metatable onto the stack and returns 1

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetStack(System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets information about the interpreter runtime stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetStack(System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaDebug@)
member.summary: Gets information about the interpreter runtime stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[k], where t is the value at the given index and k is the value at the top of the stack.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetTable(KeraLua.LuaRegistry)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[k], where t is the value at the given index and k is the value at the top of the stack.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetTop
member.summary: Returns the index of the top element in the stack. 0 means an empty stack.
member.returns: Returns the index of the top element in the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetUserValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the Lua value associated with the full userdata at the given index.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetUpValue(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about the n-th upvalue of the closure at index funcindex. It pushes the upvalue's value onto the stack and returns its name. Returns NULL (and pushes nothing) when the index n is greater than the number of upvalues. For C functions, this function uses the empty string "" as a name for all upvalues. (For Lua functions, upvalues are the external local variables that the function uses, and that are consequently included in its closure.) Upvalues have no particular order, as they are active through the whole function. They are numbered in an arbitrary order.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.Hook
member.summary: Returns the current hook function.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.HookCount
member.summary: Returns the current hook count.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.HookMask
member.summary: Returns the current hook mask.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the top element into the given valid index, shifting up the elements above this index to open space. This function cannot be called with a pseudo-index, because a pseudo-index is not an actual stack position.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsBoolean(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a boolean

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsCFunction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a C(#) function

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsFunction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a function

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is an integer

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsLightUserData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is light user data

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsNil(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is nil

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsNone(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is none

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsNoneOrNil(System.Int32)
member.summary: Check if the value at the index is none or nil

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a number

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsStringOrNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a string or a number (which is always convertible to a string)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a string NOTE: This is different from the lua_isstring, which return true if the value is a number

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a table.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsThread(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a thread.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.IsUserData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns if the value at the given index is a user data.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.IsYieldable
member.summary: Returns if the given coroutine can yield, and 0 otherwise

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Push the length of the value at the given index on the stack. It is equivalent to the '#' operator in Lua (see §3.4.7) and may trigger a metamethod for the "length" event (see §2.4). The result is pushed on the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Load(KeraLua.LuaReader,System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a Lua chunk without running it. If there are no errors, lua_load pushes the compiled chunk as a Lua function on top of the stack. Otherwise, it pushes an error message. The lua_load function uses a user-supplied reader function to read the chunk (see lua_Reader). The data argument is an opaque value passed to the reader function.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewTable
member.summary: Creates a new empty table and pushes it onto the stack

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewThread
member.summary: Creates a new thread, pushes it on the stack, and returns a pointer to a lua_State that represents this new thread. The new thread returned by this function shares with the original thread its global environment, but has an independent execution stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewUserData(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function allocates a new block of memory with the given size, pushes onto the stack a new full userdata with the block address, and returns this address. The host program can freely use this memory

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pops a key from the stack, and pushes a key–value pair from the table at the given index (the "next" pair after the given key).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PCall(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calls a function in protected mode.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PCallK(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaKFunction)
member.summary: This function behaves exactly like lua_pcall, but allows the called function to yield

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Pop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pops n elements from the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushBoolean(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pushes a boolean value with value b onto the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushCClosure(KeraLua.LuaFunction,System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes a new C closure onto the stack. When a C function is created, it is possible to associate some values with it, thus creating a C closure (see §4.4); these values are then accessible to the function whenever it is called. To associate values with a C function, first these values must be pushed onto the stack (when there are multiple values, the first value is pushed first). Then lua_pushcclosure is called to create and push the C function onto the stack, with the argument n telling how many values will be associated with the function. lua_pushcclosure also pops these values from the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushCFunction(KeraLua.LuaFunction)
member.summary: Pushes a C function onto the stack. This function receives a pointer to a C function and pushes onto the stack a Lua value of type function that, when called, invokes the corresponding C function.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushGlobalTable
member.summary: Pushes the global environment onto the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushInteger(System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes an integer with value n onto the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushLightUserData(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Pushes a light userdata onto the stack. Userdata represent C values in Lua. A light userdata represents a pointer, a void*. It is a value (like a number): you do not create it, it has no individual metatable, and it is not collected (as it was never created). A light userdata is equal to "any" light userdata with the same C address.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushObject``1(``0)
member.summary: Pushes a reference data (C# object) onto the stack. This function uses lua_pushlightuserdata, but uses a GCHandle to store the reference inside the Lua side. The CGHandle is create as Normal, and will be freed when the value is pop

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Pushes binary buffer onto the stack (usually UTF encoded string) or any arbitraty binary data

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushString(System.String)
member.summary: Pushes a string onto the stack

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushString(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Push a instring using string.Format PushString("Foo {0}", 10);

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushNil
member.summary: Pushes a nil value onto the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Pushes a double with value n onto the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushThread(KeraLua.Lua)
member.summary: Pushes the thread represented by L onto the stack. Returns true if this thread is the main thread of its state.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.PushCopy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes a copy of the element at the given index onto the stack. (lua_pushvalue) The method was renamed, since pushvalue is a bit vague

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawEqual(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the two values in indices index1 and index2 are primitively equal (that is, without calling the __eq metamethod). Otherwise returns false. Also returns false if any of the indices are not valid.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawGet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Similar to GetTable, but does a raw access (i.e., without metamethods).
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawGet(KeraLua.LuaRegistry)
member.summary: Similar to GetTable, but does a raw access (i.e., without metamethods).
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawGetInteger(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[n], where t is the table at the given index. The access is raw, that is, it does not invoke the __index metamethod.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawGetInteger(KeraLua.LuaRegistry,System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[n], where t is the table at the given index. The access is raw, that is, it does not invoke the __index metamethod.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawGetByHashCode(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the value t[k], where t is the table at the given index and k is the pointer p represented as a light userdata. The access is raw; that is, it does not invoke the __index metamethod.
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawLen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the raw "length" of the value at the given index: for strings, this is the string length; for tables, this is the result of the length operator ('#') with no metamethods; for userdata, this is the size of the block of memory allocated for the userdata; for other values, it is 0.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawSet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Similar to lua_settable, but does a raw assignment (i.e., without metamethods).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawSet(KeraLua.LuaRegistry)
member.summary: Similar to lua_settable, but does a raw assignment (i.e., without metamethods).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawSetInteger(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Does the equivalent of t[i] = v, where t is the table at the given index and v is the value at the top of the stack. This function pops the value from the stack. The assignment is raw, that is, it does not invoke the __newindex metamethod.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawSetInteger(KeraLua.LuaRegistry,System.Int64)
member.summary: Does the equivalent of t[i] = v, where t is the table at the given index and v is the value at the top of the stack. This function pops the value from the stack. The assignment is raw, that is, it does not invoke the __newindex metamethod.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RawSetByHashCode(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Does the equivalent of t[p] = v, where t is the table at the given index, p is encoded as a light userdata, and v is the value at the top of the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Register(System.String,KeraLua.LuaFunction)
member.summary: Sets the C# delegate f as the new value of global name

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the given valid index, shifting down the elements above this index to fill the gap. This function cannot be called with a pseudo-index, because a pseudo-index is not an actual stack position.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Replace(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the top element into the given valid index without shifting any element (therefore replacing the value at that given index), and then pops the top element.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Resume(KeraLua.Lua,System.Int32)
member.summary: To start a coroutine, you push onto the thread stack the main function plus any arguments; then you call lua_resume, with nargs being the number of arguments. This call returns when the coroutine suspends or finishes its execution. When it returns, the stack contains all values passed to lua_yield, or all values returned by the body function. lua_resume returns LUA_YIELD if the coroutine yields, LUA_OK if the coroutine finishes its execution without errors, or an error code in case of errors (see lua_pcall). In case of errors, the stack is not unwound, so you can use the debug API over it. The error object is on the top of the stack. To resume a coroutine, you remove any results from the last lua_yield, put on its stack only the values to be passed as results from yield, and then call lua_resume. The parameter from represents the coroutine that is resuming L. If there is no such coroutine, this parameter can be NULL.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Rotate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates the stack elements between the valid index idx and the top of the stack. The elements are rotated n positions in the direction of the top, for a positive n, or -n positions in the direction of the bottom, for a negative n. The absolute value of n must not be greater than the size of the slice being rotated. This function cannot be called with a pseudo-index, because a pseudo-index is not an actual stack position.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetAllocFunction(KeraLua.LuaAlloc,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Changes the allocator function of a given state to f with user data ud.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetField(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Does the equivalent to t[k] = v, where t is the value at the given index and v is the value at the top of the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetHook(KeraLua.LuaHookFunction,KeraLua.LuaHookMask,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the debugging hook function.
Argument f is the hook function. mask specifies on which events the hook will be called: it is formed by a bitwise OR of the constants

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetGlobal(System.String)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack and sets it as the new value of global name.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetInteger(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Does the equivalent to t[n] = v, where t is the value at the given index and v is the value at the top of the stack.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetLocal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the value of a local variable of a given activation record. It assigns the value at the top of the stack to the variable and returns its name. It also pops the value from the stack.
member.returns: Returns NULL (and pops nothing) when the index is greater than the number of active local variables.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetLocal(KeraLua.LuaDebug,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the value of a local variable of a given activation record. It assigns the value at the top of the stack to the variable and returns its name. It also pops the value from the stack.
member.returns: Returns NULL (and pops nothing) when the index is greater than the number of active local variables.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetMetaTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pops a table from the stack and sets it as the new metatable for the value at the given index.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Does the equivalent to t[k] = v, where t is the value at the given index, v is the value at the top of the stack, and k is the value just below the top

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetTop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Accepts any index, or 0, and sets the stack top to this index. If the new top is larger than the old one, then the new elements are filled with nil. If index is 0, then all stack elements are removed.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetUpValue(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the value of a closure's upvalue. It assigns the value at the top of the stack to the upvalue and returns its name. It also pops the value from the stack.
member.returns: Returns NULL (and pops nothing) when the index n is greater than the number of upvalues.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetUserValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pops a value from the stack and sets it as the new value associated to the full userdata at the given index.

member.name: P:KeraLua.Lua.Status
member.summary: The status can be 0 (LUA_OK) for a normal thread, an error code if the thread finished the execution of a lua_resume with an error, or LUA_YIELD if the thread is suspended. You can only call functions in threads with status LUA_OK. You can resume threads with status LUA_OK (to start a new coroutine) or LUA_YIELD (to resume a coroutine).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.StringToNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the zero-terminated string s to a number, pushes that number into the stack,

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToBoolean(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a C# boolean value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToCFunction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a value at the given index to a C# function. That value must be a C# function; otherwise, returns NULL

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to the signed integral type lua_Integer. The Lua value must be an integer, or a number or string convertible to an integer (see §3.4.3); otherwise, lua_tointegerx returns 0.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToIntegerX(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to the signed integral type lua_Integer. The Lua value must be an integer, or a number or string convertible to an integer (see §3.4.3); otherwise, lua_tointegerx returns 0.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given as byte array

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToBuffer(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a byte array.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a C# string

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToString(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a C# string

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a C# double

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToNumberX(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the Lua value at the given index to a C# double?

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToPointer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the value at the given index to a generic C pointer (void*). The value can be a userdata, a table, a thread, or a function; otherwise, lua_topointer returns NULL. Different objects will give different pointers. There is no way to convert the pointer back to its original value. Typically this function is used only for hashing and debug information.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToThread(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the value at the given index to a Lua thread or return the self if is the main thread

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToObject``1(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return an object (refence) at the index Important if a object was push the object need to fetched using this method, otherwise the C# object will never be collected

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ToUserData(System.Int32)
member.summary: If the value at the given index is a full userdata, returns its block address. If the value is a light userdata, returns its pointer. Otherwise, returns NULL

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.TypeName(KeraLua.LuaType)
member.summary: Returns the name of the type of the value at the given index.
member.returns: Name of the type of the value at the given index

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.UpValueId(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a unique identifier for the upvalue numbered n from the closure at index funcindex.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.UpValueIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the pseudo-index that represents the i-th upvalue of the running function

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.UpValueJoin(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Make the n1-th upvalue of the Lua closure at index funcindex1 refer to the n2-th upvalue of the Lua closure at index funcindex2

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Version
member.summary: Return the version of Lua (e.g 503)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.XMove(KeraLua.Lua,System.Int32)
member.summary: Exchange values between different threads of the same state. This function pops n values from the current stack, and pushes them onto the stack to.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Yield(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is equivalent to lua_yieldk, but it has no continuation (see §4.7). Therefore, when the thread resumes, it continues the function that called the function calling lua_yield.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.YieldK(System.Int32,System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaKFunction)
member.summary: Yields a coroutine (thread). When a C function calls lua_yieldk, the running coroutine suspends its execution, and the call to lua_resume that started this coroutine returns
member.param: Number of values from the stack that will be passed as results to lua_resume.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ArgumentCheck(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether cond is true. If it is not, raises an error with a standard message

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ArgumentError(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Raises an error reporting a problem with argument arg of the C function that called it, using a standard message that includes extramsg as a comment:

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CallMetaMethod(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: If the object at index obj has a metatable and this metatable has a field e, this function calls this field passing the object as its only argument.
member.returns: If there is no metatable or no metamethod, this function returns false (without pushing any value on the stack)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckAny(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the function has an argument of any type (including nil) at position arg.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is an integer (or can be converted to an integer)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a string and returns this string;

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a string and returns this string;

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a number and returns this number.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckOption(System.Int32,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a string and searches for this string in the array lst

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckStack(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Grows the stack size to top + sz elements, raising an error if the stack cannot grow

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckType(System.Int32,KeraLua.LuaType)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg has type type

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckObject``1(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a userdata of the type tname

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.CheckUserData(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the function argument arg is a userdata of the type tname (see luaL_newmetatable) and returns the userdata address

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.DoFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads and runs the given file
member.returns: It returns false if there are no errors or true in case of errors.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.DoString(System.String)
member.summary: Loads and runs the given string
member.returns: It returns false if there are no errors or true in case of errors.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Error(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Raises an error. The error message format is given by fmt plus any extra arguments

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.ExecResult(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function produces the return values for process-related functions in the standard library

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.FileResult(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: This function produces the return values for file-related functions in the standard library

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetMetaField(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the field e from the metatable of the object at index obj and returns the type of the pushed value

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetMetaTable(System.String)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack the metatable associated with name tname in the registry (see luaL_newmetatable) (nil if there is no metatable associated with that name)
member.returns: Returns the type of the pushed value.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.GetSubTable(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that the value t[fname], where t is the value at index idx, is a table, and pushes that table onto the stack. Returns true if it finds a previous table there and false if it creates a new table

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Length(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the "length" of the value at the given index as a number; it is equivalent to the '#' operator in Lua

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadBuffer(System.Byte[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a buffer as a Lua chunk

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Loads a buffer as a Lua chunk

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a string as a Lua chunk

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadString(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a string as a Lua chunk

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads a file as a Lua chunk. This function uses lua_load to load the chunk in the file named filename
member.returns: The status of operation

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.LoadFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a file as a Lua chunk.
member.returns: Return the status

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewLib(KeraLua.LuaRegister[])
member.summary: Creates a new table and registers there the functions in list library.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewLibTable(KeraLua.LuaRegister[])
member.summary: Creates a new table with a size optimized to store all entries in the array l (but does not actually store them)

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.NewMetaTable(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new table to be used as a metatable for userdata
member.returns: If the registry already has the key tname, returns false.,

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.OpenLibs
member.summary: Opens all standard Lua libraries into the given state.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.OptInteger(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: If the function argument arg is an integer (or convertible to an integer), returns this integer. If this argument is absent or is nil, returns d

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.OptBuffer(System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: If the function argument arg is a string, returns this string. If this argument is absent or is nil, returns d ///

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.OptString(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: If the function argument arg is a string, returns this string. If this argument is absent or is nil, returns d

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.OptNumber(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: If the function argument arg is a number, returns this number. If this argument is absent or is nil, returns d

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Ref(KeraLua.LuaRegistry)
member.summary: Creates and returns a reference, in the table at index t, for the object at the top of the stack (and pops the object).

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.RequireF(System.String,KeraLua.LuaFunction,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If modname is not already present in package.loaded, calls function openf with string modname as an argument and sets the call result in package.loaded[modname], as if that function has been called through require

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetFuncs(KeraLua.LuaRegister[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Registers all functions in the array l (see luaL_Reg) into the table on the top of the stack (below optional upvalues, see next). ///

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.SetMetaTable(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the metatable of the object at the top of the stack as the metatable associated with name tname in the registry

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.TestObject``1(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Test if the value at index is a reference data
member.param: True to release the GCHandle of object

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.TestUserData(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: This function works like luaL_checkudata, except that, when the test fails, it returns NULL instead of raising an error.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Traceback(KeraLua.Lua,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and pushes a traceback of the stack L1
member.param: Tells at which level to start the traceback

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Traceback(KeraLua.Lua,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and pushes a traceback of the stack L1
member.param: appended at the beginning of the traceback
Tells at which level to start the traceback

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.TypeName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the type of the value at the given index.

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Unref(KeraLua.LuaRegistry,System.Int32)
member.summary: Releases reference ref from the table at index t (see luaL_ref). The entry is removed from the table, so that the referred object can be collected. The reference ref is also freed to be used again

member.name: M:KeraLua.Lua.Where(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pushes onto the stack a string identifying the current position of the control at level lvl in the call stack

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaCompare
member.summary: Used by Compare

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaCompare.Equal
member.summary: compares for equality (==)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaCompare.LessThen
member.summary: compares for less than

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaCompare.LessOrEqual
member.summary: compares for less or equal

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaDebug
member.summary: Structure for lua debug information
member.remarks: Do not change this struct because it must match the lua structure lua_Debug
member.author: Reinhard Ostermeier

member.name: M:KeraLua.LuaDebug.FromIntPtr(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get a LuaDebug from IntPtr

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.Event
member.summary: Debug event code

member.name: P:KeraLua.LuaDebug.Name
member.summary: a reasonable name for the given function. Because functions in Lua are first-class values, they do not have a fixed name: some functions can be the value of multiple global variables, while others can be stored only in a table field

member.name: P:KeraLua.LuaDebug.NameWhat
member.summary: explains the name field. The value of namewhat can be "global", "local", "method", "field", "upvalue", or "" (the empty string)

member.name: P:KeraLua.LuaDebug.What
member.summary: the string "Lua" if the function is a Lua function, "C" if it is a C function, "main" if it is the main part of a chunk

member.name: P:KeraLua.LuaDebug.Source
member.summary: the name of the chunk that created the function. If source starts with a '@', it means that the function was defined in a file where the file name follows the '@'.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.CurrentLine
member.summary: the current line where the given function is executing. When no line information is available, currentline is set to -1

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.LastLineDefined
member.summary: the line number where the definition of the function ends.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.NumberUpValues
member.summary: number of upvalues

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.NumberParameters
member.summary: number of parameters

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.IsVarArg
member.summary: true if the function is a vararg function (always true for C functions).

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.IsTailCall
member.summary: true if this function invocation was called by a tail call. In this case, the caller of this level is not in the stack.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaDebug.ShortSource
member.summary: a "printable" version of source, to be used in error messages

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaGC
member.summary: Garbage Collector operations

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Stop
member.summary: Stops the garbage collector.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Restart
member.summary: Restarts the garbage collector.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Collect
member.summary: Performs a full garbage-collection cycle.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Count
member.summary: Returns the current amount of memory (in Kbytes) in use by Lua.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Countb
member.summary: Returns the remainder of dividing the current amount of bytes of memory in use by Lua by 1024

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.Step
member.summary: Performs an incremental step of garbage collection.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.SetPause
member.summary: Sets data as the new value for the pause of the collector (see §2.5) and returns the previous value

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.SetStepMultiplier
member.summary: sets data as the new value for the step multiplier of the collector

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaGC.IsRunning
member.summary: returns a boolean that tells whether the collector is running

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent
member.summary: Whenever a hook is called, its ar argument has its field event set to the specific event that triggered the hook

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent.Call
member.summary: The call hook: is called when the interpreter calls a function. The hook is called just after Lua enters the new function, before the function gets its arguments.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent.Return
member.summary: The return hook: is called when the interpreter returns from a function. The hook is called just before Lua leaves the function. There is no standard way to access the values to be returned by the function.

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent.Line
member.summary: The line hook: is called when the interpreter is about to start the execution of a new line of code, or when it jumps back in the code (even to the same line). (This event only happens while Lua is executing a Lua function.)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent.Count
member.summary: The count hook: is called after the interpreter executes every count instructions. (This event only happens while Lua is executing a Lua function.)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaHookEvent.TailCall
member.summary: Tail Call

member.name: T:KeraLua.LuaOperation

member.summary: adition(+)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Band

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Bor
member.summary: performs bitwise OR (|)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Bxor
member.summary: performs bitwise exclusive OR (~)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Shl
member.summary: performs left shift

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Shr
member.summary: performs right shift

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Unm
member.summary: performs mathematical negation (unary -)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaOperation.Bnot
member.summary: performs bitwise NOT (~)

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaStatus.ErrSyntax
member.summary: syntax error during precompilation

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaStatus.ErrMem

member.name: F:KeraLua.LuaStatus.ErrGCMM
